intro: Pilocarpus atropurpureus, commonly known as the purple pilocarpus, is a flowering plant native to the Andean regions of South America. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its woody structure and aromatic leaves. The plant produces small, clustered white flowers and is often found in dry, rocky habitats. Its leaves are used in traditional medicine for their stimulant and diuretic properties. The species is also valued for its ecological role in supporting local biodiversity.
